fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-19072].
  {panel}

Steps:
1. Setup JIRA 4.0
2. To test the support Request, I setup mail server with some arbitrary values.
3. Go to user browser and create a user and check "Send password Email" option. Click "ok".

Result:
1. In UI there is no message regarding no sending of mail but in logs user can lot of logging.

Expected:
1. In case when the mail server is not setup properly we should be giving some error message when sending mail fail.
2. No stack trace.
fields.summary: If there is problems communicating with the mail server the errors only appear in the server log

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-19057].
  {panel}

For some issues, our team captures screencasts for reproducing an issue.  There are many tools out there for this, but we happen to use Wink - http://www.debugmode.com/wink/   .  This greatly simplifies the reproduction steps for certain issues, as instead of spending lots of time describing the issue, you can simply record your clicks, export it as a SWF, and then pass that along as the reproduction steps.

We can attach the flash files to an existing issue with no problem, however, they are not easy to view within jira, as they're treated like any other file attachment instead of being treated like an image where they can just be viewed from within jira.

Similar to CONF-991 which was implemented in Confluence 1.5, we'd like to have the ability to attach flash movies just like images and have Jira be able to play them on screen (or potentially via a new popup/div like the confluence gallery plugin).  This way, someone can view the reproduction of an issue from directly inside jira instead of having to download 1-3 files (sometimes a wrapper HTML and JS file are needed, both about 2 lines each, just so the browser activates the movie) into the same directory and launch locally.

Theoretically, this could apply to Quicktime MOV's or other common file types that can be <EMBED>'d within the browser, but Flash is the primary concern here.
fields.summary: Add "Attach Flash" or "Attach Movie" similar to "Attach Screenshot"
If a user has "Browse Users" permission, show all the groups users belong to in the user profile
Firefox 3.5 seems to make two requests for each gadget content.
"Filter Results" gadget should have a checkbox for "Use filter column order"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-18990].
  {panel}

Hello,

a JIRA instance is installed and used for some time with internal user management. Later on, it is integrated with Crowd and during an upgrade, integrity violations are reported by the checker, users appear as duplicates, etc...

This is caused by having used - at some previous stage - in osuser.xml configuration both internal and Crowd providers.

JIRA could log or refuse to startup until the configuration is fixed and only one such provider is selected.


Best Regards,
Edoardo
fields.summary: JIRA could throw an Error on multiple providers configured in osuser.xml

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-18983].
  {panel}

# Create a new navigator searcher and leave it blank.
# Click on the "View" tab.

!empty_view.png!

Should we display a message in the results area indicating that there were was no results because there was no search. The small description on the left is easy to miss.
fields.summary: Issue Navigator "view" mode looks a little bare when no filter in session.

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA
2. Open any issue and try to delete the issue.

Result:
1. The focus is not by default on "delete" button.

Expected:
1. By default the focus should be on "delete" button.
fields.summary: The focus is by default not there on "delete" button when user click "Delete" link for issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-18919].
  {panel}

Hello all,

please consider the following scenario:
# JIRA is deployed standalone and users and groups are created in the internal database
# filters are shared - among groups, in particular and subscriptions to these are enabled
# JIRA is then subsequently integrated with Crowd and some of these groups are lost in the process
# the integrity checker will report the following message rather than correctly identify a subscription to a filter shared with a non-existent group:  
{noformat}
Subscription filter with id #### is missing its corresponding saved filter and will be removed
{noformat}

It would be desirable if the integrity checker would: 
# check for filters shared to non existing users/groups
# perform more context as to why the filter is now missing and should be removed


Best Regards,
Edoardo
fields.summary: Integrity checker could manage subscripton permission revocation more clearly
Subquery / Subfilter in JQL
Custom reminder (alert) on regard of estimated time on the task
We should use POST instead of GET when retrieving data for gadgets
Issue views silently limited to tempMax issues
Add optional pagination to the Favourite filters gadget
First Impressions - When setting up a first project, select the only name you can put

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-18853].
  {panel}

Currently when a first time admin has setup an empty JIRA he goes thought three steps.

Step 3 says "well done..now login" and gives a login link.

Why dont we allow him to login right there and then "with the user name" they gave us in step 2.

It would be a bit easier and make a better "first impression".
fields.summary: First Impressions - Setup step 3 improvement.  Allow them to login then and there

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-18844].
  {panel}

Steps:
1.Upgraded the JIRA 4.0 with customer data at https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-39999
2. Login as "dtc1824". The user is JIRA admin.
3. User has a favorite filter gadget on dashboard and click open to view "Current Iteration Report". The number of issues shown is 0 and in 3.13.5 is 13.
4. Click to view the actual query.

Result:
1. The query doesn't give user any error message but on clicking "Edit" takes user to advanced view(simple view is not allowed) with no error message. The query is "fixVersion = 10648 AND project = ATCWF ORDER BY key DESC". The issue here is that fixversion is hidden for this project.
2. I successfully reproduce this issue in JIRA 4.0.
3. Create 1 project with version 1, 2. Save a filter in simple view by selecting the project and fixVersion value.
4. Now the admin has make the fixversion field hidden for this project.
5. Execution of filter doesn't give error message as its a valid JQL query in JIRA 4.0 but for user upgrading to JIRA 4.0, it will unclear what is showing the different result, when filter is not showng any error message

Expected:
1. User should be notified of problem while viewing filter
fields.summary: JIRA doesn't show filter error if "fix version" is removed from field configuration for a project after filter is created.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-18839].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 13 Jan 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; however there are no immediate plans to put this suggestion on our near term roadmap.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Daniel Franz
dfranz@atlassian.com
Principal Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
  

Hi,
I need to filter sub-tasks with certain values and the parent issue have a customfield to filter too.
Example:

parent=(cf[10000]="ParentValue1") AND cf[10001]="Subtaskvalue3"

where cf[10000] is a parent customfield and cf[10001] is a subtask customfiel.

Other dreamed example:

parent.cf[10000]="ParentValue1" AND subtask.cf[10001]="Subtaskvalue3"


Is possible? Thanks.
fields.summary: Create a JQL functionality to filter the sub-task for a field value of the parent issue
The browse project page should respect Resolution field visibility when deciding what fragments to display.
It would be good to list all the plugin points and the plugins that implement them
Exclude Closed issues in Time Tracking Report

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-18739].
  {panel}

{code}

AxisFault
 faultCode: {http://xml.apache.org/axis/}Client.NoSOAPAction
 faultSubcode: 
 faultString: no SOAPAction header!
 faultActor: 
 faultNode: 
 faultDetail: 
        {http://xml.apache.org/axis/}stackTrace:no SOAPAction header!
        at org.apache.axis.transport.http.AxisServlet.getSoapAction(AxisServlet.java:1013)
        at org.apache.axis.transport.http.AxisServlet.doPost(AxisServlet.java:678)
        at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:710)
        at org.apache.axis.transport.http.AxisServletBase.service(AxisServletBase.java:327)

        at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:215)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:188)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.IteratingFilterChain.doFilter(IteratingFilterChain.java:46)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.doFilter(ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.java:55)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.doFilter(ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.java:41)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:215)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:188)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.accesslog.AccessLogFilter.executeRequest(AccessLogFilter.java:154)

        at com.atlassian.seraph.filter.SecurityFilter.doFilter(SecurityFilter.java:206)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:215)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:188)
        at com.atlassian.security.auth.trustedapps.filter.TrustedApplicationsFilter.doFilter(TrustedApplicationsFilter.java:98)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-18737].

For this warning, the stack trace does not need to be logged because it is always the same stack. It just fills up the logs with useless information.
fields.summary: Jira Logs should not log the stack trace when identifying an action creation failure.
ensure gadgets work properly in igoogle

fields.description:
The default colors for priorities as seen at http://localhost:8080/secure/admin/ViewPriorities.jspa are very poor choices for colorblind people (10% of men). I realize these can be changed, but why not pick some defaults that work better? For example, how about these:

1 #ff0000
2 #660000
3 #009900 (no change)
4 #006600 (no change)
5 #cc3300

Also, please get someone to check the colors locally - I bet you a beer you have a colorblind guy on staff somewhere!
fields.summary: Default priority colours are not colour blind friendly

fields.description:
I like being able to link easily from one issue to another (e.g. TST-19036) -- we evaluated FogBugz and they have a great feature which is that when you mouse over a link to another issue, after about 500 msec you get a small popup showing a summary of the linked issue. JIRA does show the summary, but in "tooltip" format with no other information, and you have to wait 3 seconds.

This would be a great feature to be able to enable; anything that reduces having to navigate to another web page in favor of making information more transparently accessible, is a really good improvement in my book. Otherwise I can see myself jumping back and forth thinking "now what was that other issue again?" Ideally you could customize which fields would be displayed on a popup (e.g. like 1st 500 characters of description, last comment, etc.)
fields.summary: Add issue summary popup when hovering over an issue key
Add possibility to search linked issues from specific project not just issue
Improve database startup checks to catch SQLException when asking for the Connection
User Browser filter form should use GET, not POST
Issue link drop down should respect history order

fields.description:
For me it would be very convenient when *Actions* column will be very first, not very last.
On my screen the most important columns go first in issue navigator.
fields.summary: Ability to move "Actions" column in issue navigator when configuring Issue Navigator Columns

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-18594].
  {panel}

In Jira 3.13.5, a "ccwatcher" option was added that can add existing users whose email has been CCed on an issue as watchers.

Here in the customer's own words is their use case:

{quote}
We use Jira for our Client Services (Support) team to log issues. It
would be very useful for the team to be able to see who is cc'd on an
email. For many of our clients the people who are cc'd often do not have
an account within Jira but it would be very useful for people here to
know who is concerned by the case they are working on. We require a list
of the email addresses of those people who have been cc'd to appear on
the ticket. There is no need for accounts to be created for these people
but if this makes it easier to achieve the list we are looking for this
would not be an issue.
{quote}

Adding the ability to create accounts based on CC members that don't exist would be one way to satisfy this use case.
fields.summary: Add ability to create new user accounts for the CC list for issues created from emails
Implement a blocking shutdown of the Scheduler with a timeout

fields.description:
Use case I have a list of issues, I wish to update the majority of them in different ways e.g. update priority /add a comment / change Fix Version, right now I have to:

1.	Select the filter
2.	Select the first issue

3.	Select edit
4.	Do the edit
5.	Select update or cancel 
6.	Select next 
7.	Repeat step 3

The workflow I would like 

1.	Select the filter
2.	Select the first issue

3.	Do the edit
4.	Select next (this saves the change)
5.	Repeat step 3
fields.summary: Move through a list directly from edit page to edit page
Ability to disable smileys
Creating a SOAP client
Inconsistent x-axis labels on "daily" chart (days vs weeks)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-18545].
  {panel}

Steps:.
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Suppose user has a saved query like project =x and affectedversion =7.
3. User select the filter from manage filter and click edit, the query get open in simple navigator as that was the last selected choice.
4. User select project = y and click "View". User has ignored the "blue refresh" link unknowingly.

Result:
1. The user is now in advanced view with the query and 0 matching result.
2. If he/she tries to go to simple view, gets message query is too complex to display in simple view as there is no affectedversion =7 for project =y.
 

Expected:
1.Taken to advanced view on clicking view is confusing to user, we should handle it in simple view itself and give error message.
2. User is expecting some result when he/she clicks on view and not sifting of dialog.
fields.summary: Viewing a filter in simple navigator and changing search option, on clicking "view" takes user to advanced view
Change history of status is lacking information

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-18527].
  {panel}

High-Level Summary: Drill down capability from the top (enterprise level) to a specific issue's detail info (Fount in all Enterprise-level Project Management tools) 

Details:
I really need drill down capability starting at the highest level, and then moving deeper and deeper until I get to the lowest level of data in JIRA. An example of this is as follows:

Lansing Community College (pie chart) -> Information Technology Services (ITS)(pie chart) -> Enterprise Systems (ES) (pie chart) -> ES Projects (pie chart) -> All Issue Types for a Given ES Project (pie chart) -> All Issues for a Specific Issue Type selected (tabular) -> the bottom line data for one Issue (detail page)

The idea is that this would be a graph that would show each of these levels. For the first level (LCC), there could be such areas as ITS, HR, IER, etc. for each slice to show the different organizations that are being tracked within JIRA here at LCC. In my example, we chose the path of ITS. For ITS, there could be Server, Data Center, Enterprise Systems (ES), Help Desk, etc. each showing as a pie slice.
For this example, I chose ES. Then, the pie chart would show a slice for every ES project currently in JIRA (including Open, Re-Opened, etc.). In this example, I chose one specific project, and then another pie chart would show all Issues for that one project (a slice per Issue Type showing the number of each Issue Type in JIRA for that project). Then, you would choose one slice of the pie chart to drill down to look at a list of all of the issues being tracked for that one project for that one Issue Type. This would now show in the normal tabular format that one normally sees in JIRA. Finally, you would select a specific issue, and see the bottom line data for that one issue.

In order to do the high level filtering, we would add in custom fields to track what Org and Sub-Orgs the Issue Types are tied to, so all the data necessary to do this drill down would already be in JIRA. And, to make this work, all that really is needed is to have the ability to have the first (top level) pie chart start with a default filter. Once the user clicks on one of the slices of the pie chart, then the next pie chart would be dynamically created based on whatever slice was chosen. The query for each pie chart is identical, but the data being searched on is different based on what slice was selected. That is what would need to be "loaded" into the filter before the query was executed and the new pie chart built. This would continue down the path until you reached the existing JIRA functionality of showing the tabular results and then ultimately the detail page for the one specific issue you are reviewing.
fields.summary: Drill Down Capability - Enterprise to Issue Detail Graphical Drill Down Capability Needed

fields.description:

Steps:
1. Download the standalone JIRA 4.0 build.
2. Start JIRA and in the setup screen, enter the expired evaluation license. 
3. Click "Next" to proceed to next page.

Result:
1. No error or warning message.
2. User can proceed with creation of user name and logging to JIRA.
3. Best part of all is that, once user login still there is no warning or error message. User can go and happily create project/user etc and when try to create issue...we give big message. It's surely fucking the customer.

Expected:
1. The least we can do here it to show a warning message before user proceed to next screen.
2. User should be directed to generate valid evaluation link.

Hello,

certain clients have difficulty interpreting empty tags in HTML emails and will format them incorrectly basically falling prey of the problem implied by paragraph [C.2|http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/#C_2] of the XHTML1.0 ref.

Editing the Velocity templates for HTML mail JIRA sends would help in this regard and shouldn't affect recent email client programs

fields.description:
Stories typically have a lot of subtasks.  When I move a story from one iteration to the next this means changing the fix version.  What I then need to do is go through each sub task and update the fix version.  I know I can do this with greenhopper but sometimes I am not using GH for this level of planning.

As an alternative to GH it would be great to add a new item to the actin menu you see on the parent issue for each sub task.  This new item syncs the fix version of the selected sub task with the fix version of the current parent issue.
fields.summary: Add 'Set Fix Version to Parent Fix Version' to the action menu for subtasks

    *  The list is very long, its hard to find the columns you are after (it took me a while just to find the issue key column), perhaps you could add a few key ones at the top of the list as well (e.g Key and Name).
    * There is no horizontal ordering available, it only does it alphabetically, so there is no way to achieve "the default plus one extra column". This could be helped by just ensuring that if they select the issue key, it will get put on the leftmost column no matter what.
    * Gadget width was an interesting hurdle. I added a bunch of columns and they just got hidden off the side in such a way that i didn't even realise that there was more to see. Maybe a scroll bar or something to provide a visual indication that there is more data off to the side.
    * Is there somewhere where you can change your personal gadget defaults - set columns, horizontal ordering and sorting?? Something like this would be cool, it would mean I didn't have to pick all the columns every time I created a gadget (and would overcome most of my previous points).

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-18177].
  {panel}

The [email integration document|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/issue_creation_email.html#N100DC] explains: 

bq. JIRA examines the email subject and the in-reply-to message for an existing issue reference to determine whether a new issue or comment should be created...

And then, the [FullCommentHandler|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/services.html#N104CF] and the [NonQuotedCommentHandler|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/services.html#N105A1] explain:

bq. The issue to use is chosen from the first issue key found in the email subject

And the [CreateOrCommentHandler|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/services.html#N1035E]:

bq. If the subject contains an issue key, the message is added as a comment to that issue. If no issue key is found, a new issue is created in the default project.

All that information is not accurate enough. This is the way it works:

For the FullCommentHandler and the NonQuotedCommentHandler, first we check the mail subject for an issue id. If it is found, we attempt to add a comment to that issue. If no issue id is found in the subject, we check the in-reply-to header on the email, and cross check with all the notifications Jira has sent. If there is a match, we comment on the issue that originated the notification. If not issue is found, the email will not comment any issue.

For the CreateOrCommentHandler, we follow the same process to identify on which issue to comment, but if no issue is found, we create a new one.

It would be good to add this level of detail in the documentation, as we have had several customers confused about this functionality,
fields.summary: Issue/Comment Creation document not detailed enough

fields.description:

I was trying to CC Jonathan Nolen on one of the tickets. By mistake I typed his user name into the 'CC Group' text field.
JIRa happily created that group even though it does not exist. I don't believe this is intended behaviour? Is it?

https://support.atlassian.com/secure/admin/user/ViewGroup.jspa?name=jnolen

However,the group picker does not fetch that group??
https://support.atlassian.com/secure/admin/user/ViewGroup.jspa?name=jnolen

May one of you look into it please.

Thanks
Ivan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-18143].
  {panel}

Each version of JIRa has a different built number (by design)

However project restricts itself to data on the exact same build number.

So imagine a XML exported on 3.13.1.  This data cannot be imported into 3.13.4, even though there are no upgrades anc changes to the data logically.

The reason it does this is that it naively assumes that different build numbers means the upgrade tasks need to be run and the configuration of the data needs to be transformed.

The improvement would be for project import to check ask the upgrade system if there are any upgrade tasks and if the answer is 0, then allow the import.

So you would be able to move from 3.13.x to 3.13.x+n but not 4.x for example.  This is a big improvement in my book.
fields.summary: Project import cant bring in data that is logically equaivalent
JIRA Heatmaps e.g. correlating user and component

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-18119].
  {panel}

Dear Atlassian,

I have checked the JiRA DB structure but didn't find the logs/history when a particular version has been added to the JiRA project. I think current JiRA DB is not storing the version creation date. Currently I can find only the list/sequence in which they has been added.

 We would like to have a more column under 'projectversion' table where it maintain the version creation date, it will help us in filtering when the version has been created. 
It would be great if we capture this version creation date from JiRA frontend instead of running the query on database.


Regards,
- Vishal
fields.summary: Version creation data to be stored in JiRA DB
API to enable or disable plugin modules in bulk.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-18107].
  {panel}

Tracking issues for a software with different branches is a bit more demanding because you have to identify the branches one issue affects and possibly separately fix them on each branch. One and the same issue could have different resolutions per branch, i.e. invalid if a broken functionality does not exist anymore. Nevertheless, all branches have to be checked, likely in different time frames.

Unfortunately JIRA does not support the notion of branches. You have to emulate the behaviour using different schemes like:

    * One issue per version that represents a branch
    * Multiple fix versions for an issue
    * Subtasks for an issue or issue links to ckeck and fix the issue for different versions

Real branching support could help you check on which branch an issue is done, where it has still to be resolved and so on without adding more and more (perhaps loosely connected) issues to your system or forgetting to fix the issue on some branch (no question/warning when resolving an issue with multiple fix versions).
fields.summary: Explicit Branching Support

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-18099]. {panel} It would be useful to be able to set the security level on an issue to include everyone who participated on an issue so if you had a security level that was only the reporter and the assignee, if the issue needs to get reassigned the issue could still be seen by the original assignee. The JIRA Toolkit has a participants custom field which could be used to do this, but unfortunately it doesn't show up in the "User Custom Field Value" section. However, I tried to modify {{/secure/admin/views/issuesecurity/addissuesecurity.jsp}} and hardcoded the participants custom field as an option for the "User Custom Field Value" section: e.g. from JIRA 3.13.4 {code:xml} {code} This seemed to work so It would be good if we picked up any custom field that implements {{UserCFNotificationTypeAware}} (I'm guessing that is why this works).
fields.summary: Allow issue security level to use any custom field that implements UserCFNotificationTypeAware

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-18079].
  {panel}

When trying to "Edit" a filter, meaning update the query, my logical path would be as follows:
# Click on the filter taking me to *Issue Navigator*
# Click on "*Edit* current filter details" under *Operations*

However, this only let's me edit the name, description, and permissions:
!http://img.skitch.com/20090724-kesfb94rpd4ju6gymx387eh1kf.png!

Requiring me to click another "Edit" option located somewhere else.

Then, after making changes to the filter AND running it, I have to click back to "View" in order to click "Save" in the *Operations* menu where I started.
!http://img.skitch.com/20090724-8bx2y9g4re36s1aaaxt98c5gju.png!


This flow could be improved and/or clarified with more clear instructions.
fields.summary: Two "Edit" filter options lead to confusion

Feature Request from a customer: 

{quote}
Is there any way to visualize (Table) whats the PLANNED (Future) Workload for a user/developer.
Should give at least following info:


|| Resource 1 || Mon || Tue || Wed || Thu || Fri || Mon 1{color:#339966}(Today){color} || Tue 2 || Wed 3 || Thu 4 || Fri 5 || Mon 8 || Tue 9 || Wed 10 || Thu 11 || Fri 12 ||
|| TST-1 | 8h | 2h | 1h  | 2h | 2h | 1h | 6h | 3h | 5h | 2h | 1h | 6h | 3h | 5h | 2h ||
|| TST-2 | 0h | 2h  | 3h | 2h  | 2h | 3h | 2h | 3h | {color:red}5h{color} | 2h | 3h | 2h | 3h | {color:#ff0000}5h{color} | 2h ||
|| XYZ-3 | 0h | 2h | 2h | 2h | 2h | 2h | {color:red}2h{color} | 2h | 0h | 2h | 2h | {color:red}2h{color} | 2h | {color:#ff0000}5h{color} | 2h ||
|| PSP-4 | 0h | 2h  | 2h | 2h | 2h \\ | 1h | {color:red}1h{color} | {color:red}1h{color} | {color:red}1h{color} | 2h | 1h | {color:red}1h{color} | {color:red}1h{color} | {color:red}1h{color} | 2h ||
|| Sum | *8h*  | *8h* | *8h* | *8h*  | *8h* | *7h* | *11h* | *9h* | *11h* | *8h* | *7h* | *11h* | *11h* | *16h* | *8h* ||

The red estimates show where the ressource is more than fully streched.
{quote}

There are plugins that do the historical part, and the developer workload shows how much work a user has remaining but not the breakdown day by day.
fields.summary: Historical and Future Planned Workload report
Create a navigable field for "watches" that shows the total number of watchers for an issue

fields.description:
JIRA Issues are used to discuss et and to think. Each user can use comments.
We upload attachments. When we read the JIRA issue, the attachments are listed in alphabetical order. This is very disturbing, because we lost time to find the last uploaded file.

The purpose of this improvement is to sort the attachments by chronological order of upload.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-17861].
  {panel}

I'll explain this with a use case....

I need to get our developers to submit a 'Status Report' on a particular issue type (normally once a week). I've created a workflow transition called 'Report Status' which brings up a reporting screen (works well). The 'Status Report' is a free text custom field. Whenever they update the 'Status Report' via the transition+screen I would like to set a custom date field called 'Status Report Date' to $TODAY$.

This will record when the last 'Status Report' was submitted.

Thanks.

p.s. sorry if this is a duplicate.

ALTERNATIVELY.....
I can't validate that they have updated 'Status Report Date'==TODAY manually either.
fields.summary: Workflow Transition Post Function - Assign a custom date field TODAY
Upgrade to atlassian wiki renderer 5.0 or newer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-17808].
  {panel}

On DB2, If you create a scheme JIRA, during startup tables with names that start with JIRA will not be found even though the tables exist:
\\
\\
{noformat}2009-06-30 13:20:10,827 main [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] SQL Exception while executing the following:
CREATE TABLE JIRA.jiraworkflows (ID DECIMAL(18,0) NOT NULL, workflowname VARCHAR(255), creatorname VARCHAR(255), DESCRIPTOR CLOB, ISLOCKED VARCHAR(60), CONSTRAINT PK_jiraworkflow PRIMARY KEY (ID))
Error was: com.ibm.db2.jcc.b.nm: DB2 SQL Error: SQLCODE=-601, SQLSTATE=42710, SQLERRMC=JIRA.JIRAWORKFLOWS;TABLE, DRIVER=3.50.152
2009-06-30 13:20:10,829 main [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Table named "JIRAACTION" exists in the database but has no corresponding entity
2009-06-30 13:20:10,829 main [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Table named "JIRADRAFTWORKFLOWS" exists in the database but has no corresponding entity
2009-06-30 13:20:10,829 main [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Table named "JIRAEVENTTYPE" exists in the database but has no corresponding entity
2009-06-30 13:20:10,829 main [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Table named "JIRAISSUE" exists in the database but has no corresponding entity
2009-06-30 13:20:10,829 main [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Table named "JIRAPERMS" exists in the database but has no corresponding entity
2009-06-30 13:20:10,830 main [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Table named "JIRAWORKFLOWS" exists in the database but has no corresponding entity
{noformat}

All the other tables that don't begin with JIRA will be found correctly. This does not affect the operation of JIRA - it will still work correctly.

This seems specific to DB2, postgresql doesn't exhibit the same behaviour.
fields.summary: DB2 raises errors on startup if you use a schema name that matches the start of table names e.g. JIRA
ActionContext.getSession() creates a new session, even when it doesn't need to

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-17783].
{panel}
||15 September 2021||
|Dashboard owners can now grant edit permissions to your dashboards in Jira Cloud! To try it out, go to a dashboard you own and select *···* > *Edit and share*. 
  
 We are aware there is high demand for the same functionality for Filters. This is something on our short-term radar and I will keep you updated when work is in progress.
  
 Please note that for enterprise customers that have opted into bundled product release tracks (see [https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/manage-product-release-tracks|https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/manage-product-release-tracks/] ), you may experience a delay in having this feature turned on. For more information, please talk to your Jira administrator. 
  
 Marcus Wong
 Product Manager, Jira Shared Experiences|
||18 August 2021||
|Hi everyone, an update on ticket progress.
  
 We are on track to ship the ability to share/delegate edit permissions for dashboards. We anticipate these changes to land in your Jira instances during the month of September. 
 Thank you for your continued patience as we work through this complex problem.
  
 However, we recognise this ticket also mentions support for allowing edit permissions for shared *filters*. This feature will not be shipping by September, and will be in our long-term backlog until we ship some of the more impactful changes first. We know this isn't ideal; we're working on it.
  
 Stay tuned for the announcement of edit permissions in Dashboards, but we will continue to keep this ticket open until we resolve both dashboard and filter features.
  
 Thank you.
  
 Marcus Wong
 Product Manager, Jira Shared Experiences|
||14 May 2021||
|Hello everyone, 
  
 A quick update on the progress made on this ticket. We're needing a bit more time than expected to tackle what is a challenging permissions
 problem. We are anticipating a completion date in the 3rd quarter of 2021 (July - Sep).
  
 Once again, we appreciate your patience; and understand some of you have waited a long, long time for this. Please bear with us!
  
 Marcus Wong
 Product Manager, Jira Shared Experiences|
||15 March 2021||
|Hi everyone, good news!
  
 We have kicked off work to bring edit permissions to Dashboards in Jira Cloud. This feature request is now *In Progress*.
  
 We know this work is important to many of your workflows - we ask for your continued patience as we work through the implementation.
  
 Marcus Wong
 Product Manager, Jira Shared Experiences|
||2 March 2021||
|Hi all,
 I'm Marcus, a Product Manager from the Jira Shared Experiences team.
  
 Thank you for your votes and comments on this ticket. This has helped our team revisit this issue and communicate your customer pain to relevant stakeholders internally.
  
 We are currently considering implementing this ticket in our short-term backlog. The magnitude of this task is quite large, so we ask for your continued patience. We will formally transition the ticket to "In Progress" as soon as our team has a clearer understanding of what is required. 
  
 Marcus Wong
 Product Manager, Jira Shared Experiences|

*Original request description:*

Certain reporting-type filters, used by project management or other groups, may have multiple users managing them. It would be great to have the ability to specify group-ownership of a filter, allowing anyone in the group to edit the filter, so the same filter remains in use, rather than saving as ... and having to notify all consumers of the original filter of the new filter.
fields.summary: Allow shared filters and dashboards to be edited by a group

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-17782].
  {panel}

in a draft workflow i can not delete a step altough no issu has the status of the step.
i can not add a new transition to the problematic step.

you can see what i mean in the screenshot.
for a new added step there are all the options. for the step i want to delete there i miss the options.

regards,
michael
fields.summary: Allow to delete a step from an active workflow if there are no issues in that step

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-17780].
  {panel}

There is a global property in JIRA called "jira.path.backup" that is used for the backup path when:

* Doing an upgrade.
* Doing an import.

This property can only be set during "Setup" and then is set for the life of the JIRA data (i.e. it is transferred with the XML).

Now we have the JIRA home, do we actually need this property. For instance we could:

# Try to dump any XML into the directory configured for a backup service.
# If this does not work, dump into "JIRA.HOME/export" 

At the very least, we should allow this property to be set after the initial install. Maybe we should be able to specify the direct during the import or before the upgrade?
fields.summary: There are two backup paths in JIRA.
provide links to facilitate screen administration in JIRA
Properly support HTML in select-list options

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-17740].
  {panel}

The method getNotificationSchemeForProject in the type NotificationSchemeManager is not applicable for the arguments (Project) even though Project.getGenericValue() is a deprecated method.

Please rectify this disparity.

Best regards,
Mihaela CUTUI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-17738].
  {panel}

In order to set for example the lead of a project, there is no setter on the Project object, instead one should use the project.getGenericValue.set("lead", userName), even though the Project.getGenericValue is a deprecated method.

Please rectify this disparity.

Best regards,
Mihaela CUTUI
fields.summary: Disparity with Project and GenericValue

FileService should complain more loudly when it can't process files

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-17720].
  {panel}

Hello all,

another method to capture thread dumps should be added to the documentation page: [Thread Dump|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.13.2/threaddump.html].

Since JDK1.5 the following general procedure is possible:
* identify the PID of the JIRA process
** on Microsoft Windows configure the Task Manager to display process PIDs (View > Select Columns... > PID) and search for Image Name "tomcat5.exe"
** on UNIX like systems use command "{{ps}}"
* on a command line shell and execute the following:
** "JDK_PATH/bin/jstack.exe -l PID >> WRITABLE_PATH/threaddump.log" (works on both Microsoft Windows and UNIX)
* attach the generated file

Best,
Eddy
fields.summary: Thread Dump documentation enhancement
